Reviews.Title: “New years eve!”
Reviews.Author: Lynne K
Reviews.Content: Absolute shambles! booked in advance agessss before new years gave them credit card number and our name and address and was told thats fine see you new years eve, rang again new years eve to tell them we were on our way and they turned around and said we have no recollection of your booking EVEN THOUGH THEY TOOK OUR CRED CARD DETAILS OVER THE PHONE! ruined our new years plans and staff were very rude, shouting and not even appologetic on the phone! be warned do not stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting place”
Reviews.Author: rswong
Reviews.Content: How they even call this a hotel? It's the worst place I've ever stayed. They put me on the top floor and there is no elevator. I wonder if my room was ever cleaned. Please don't stay here as there are lots of options near Paddington train/tube station.

Reviews.Title: “Almost killed my London experience.”
Reviews.Author: WantsToTravel60763
Reviews.Content: I'm American and had a six hour flight in order to get to the UK, but when I saw this hotel I wanted to turn right back around and see if I could get a flight back that night. I feel skeezy just looking at the bed, the desk wobbles. Free WiFi is a joke because I MAYBE can load Google. If I'm lucky and it's like 3AM (which is fine, with the state of the bed I barely wanted to sleep). The staircase does not feel sturdy and may in fact be falling apart. There are no other exits, there's no real handles on the door and staff leaves the room unlocked after cleaning. I don't know if that is normal over there, but I doubt it. The breakfast is terrible, the staff person who runs it literally sat and watched Real Housewives of where ever when there was no water in the kettle. The room wasn't serviced when they gave it to us. The room smelled, probably from the carpet, the shower didn't close properly, and the hot water was iffy at best. One of the beds in the twin room was held up with a piece of plywood where the frame had bent. The towels were so worn I would have to dry myself with the clothes I wore the day before. There's stuff all over the stairs and there were TVs sitting on the third floor landing for no reason other than the fact that I don't think these people know what a trash can (rubbish bin?) is. Basically, I felt like I was squatting in some drug or prostitution motel. Actually, that's an insult to both of those things. At least they service the rooms before giving them to someone else usually. Only stay here if it is the LAST OPTION for one night. Actually, I'd rather sleep in Paddington station. It seemed cleaner to me. It's that bad.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AT YOUR OWN PERIL”
Reviews.Author: snowyowen
Reviews.Content: room very basic. carpet stinking and smelling. shower cracked and mouldy,only 1 shower door. didn't need it anyway as there was no hot water. At breakfast member of staff did nothing but blow his nose and scrape his throat. same dirty t-shirt that he worn the day before. French fella was sleeping in the lobby 9am guy on reception gave him a room someone had just checked out of(NOT SERVICED) just to move him out of sight !!!!!! DISGUSTING

Reviews.Title: “I Survived !”
Reviews.Author: laura_eva
Reviews.Content: Late night drinks in the Paddington Hilton "Steam Bar" with friends meant I just missed my last 2:00 am train and would have had near a 3 hour wait on a cold platform ... Hilton was resolute on Â£150 a room (used the hotel at a friend's expense ... and lovely if you check in early enough to use the facilities ... but not at 2:00am) ! So I crossed the road and the Sophia was still open. Negotiated Â£35 for a room ... ran off to grab a quick take-away ... asleep 3am ... Woken at 10am to the sound of rumbling tube trains ... Sheets were clean, bathroom primitive but useable, only for emergency accommodation, sleep two for Â£45, might be well OK for backpackers. Most basic hotel, but no bed bugs and offers rooms at the price of a meal ... better than an outdoor sleeping bag ... and negotiable prices as nobody pre-books expecting a proper hotel ! Its a clean bed for the night, that's all.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: Aria91
Reviews.Content: Please avoid this hotel. Extremely untidy, old furniture, dust and dirt everywhere! Furniture is possibly picked up in a dump. Breakfast was terrible. When a cup dropped on the floor the hotel staff just picked it up and put back on table... Very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “The Pits”
Reviews.Author: GoldenOldies99
Reviews.Content: The entrance, staircase and bedroom carpets were threadbare and had not seen a hoover this year, the walls in the same areas needed a coat of paint. The room description said there were tea and coffee facilities in the room (not in our room or any of our friends), the curtains just about reached each side of the window. Toilet paper was so thin it was almost transparent and the metal stand for accommodating your personal belongings was totally inadequate and filthy dirty. One of our major concerns was the lack of information in the rooms, on the landings and staircase for the procedure should there be a fire, there were no external fire escapes and the only route down was the main staircase. Finally we have travelled to various places around the world but have never had to make our own tea and coffee at breakfast, even at self service breakfasts you are asked for your preference then this is brought to your table. My husband went up to make a drink and the kettle was empty, he then had to go into the kitchen and fill it himself. Would we stay there again NO NEVER. "Golden Oldies"

Reviews.Title: “not my cup of tea and im not posh”
Reviews.Author: AussieLady40
Reviews.Content: I had to ask for toilet paper and was given tissues .. finally got a roll of toilet paper which was less than 1 ply. Was laying in bed in the afternoon relaxing and a member of staff just walked in .. didnt even knock. The place is untidy and a massive OH&S hazard .. no help offered with the bags and was always stuff i.e. dirty sheets and cleaning equipment in the stairs which were already quite narrow. Bonus was free WIFI. Room was reasonably quiet and a spare television that didnt work seemed to be stored in the room as well. On arrival that member of staff was friendly and polite but nobody else. Also on the last night people were up and about all night partying

Reviews.Title: “Basic, budget price hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1234Dave
Reviews.Content: Basic, no frills, budget priced hotel. No complaints, was a bit better than I was expecting for the price. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Sherlock Homes & the mystery of the pink toilet paper!”
Reviews.Author: halperkins
Reviews.Content: Close to Paddo tube-great. Cheap & cheerful but she says smelled of insecticide! Linen clean but bed-spread dodgy.Smelly shower curtain but bathroom ideal for the contortionists none the less. However there was something very amusing about this place. They had stuffed pink toilet paper all around perimeter of room between carpet & wall! Extracted a piece for further inspection but unable to come to any logical conclusion. Love their worki! Quiet despite day-time construction next door & some slamming of doors late at night. I'd come back but you know women!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice & helpful”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeRome
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 2 years back and we came back because of the staff and manager were very helpful. When we came this time they have improved the rooms quality, service and cleanliness of the room. We really enjoyed staying here as it's very convenient location and very friendly staff and it's value for your money hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good experience”
Reviews.Author: reachmambo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in hotel Sophia as it was the only hotel available due to our last minute trip plans and it was not a good experience as the rooms are very small and congested. The rooms are furnished with a queen size bed which leaves hardly any space to move around. I would advice this hotel for tourists who are into hard core sight seeing and plan to spend very less time in the room. They should concentrate a bit on the hygiene of the rooms as they are not well kempt. The hotel has some pluses for example, their buffet breakfast is very good and tasty. Also, the location is great. It is in walkable distance from the Paddington train station and also easilty connected to all the touriest attractions. The staff is very diligent.

Reviews.Title: “Complete Disgrace to the Hotel Industry”
Reviews.Author: Christelle37
Reviews.Content: Arrived late at night having been forced to stay in London after a 24 hour journey across europe escaping the consequences of volcanic ash. Charged Â£60 for a room with no curtain, that stank of mould, had crud in the carpet and a shower we dared not use. No wardrobe, or cupboards, but plenty of stains on the bed sheets. It was so bad, even after 24 hours of travelling, we left after a 3.5 hour kip to catch the earliest escape from Paddington station.

Reviews.Title: “Only to be described as 'an experience'!!!”
Reviews.Author: redandwhite76
Reviews.Content: We got moved to Hotel Sophia after a problem with a booking at another hotel. Well what can we say, we arrived in our room to find the bed cover had cigarette burns all over it, our carpet was underlayed with pink toliet paper and our smoke detector was stuffed with it!!! The cleaner appears to have forgotten how to use a vacuum cleaner and where the bathroom is. I think health and safety would have a field day here. Oh well we thought at least its a bed to sleep in, how wrong were we. Being close to a tube station definately has its draw backs and overnight engineering works below your bedroom window are the main one. It was an experiance to say the least, capped off by finding somebody sleeping in the breakfast room when we went down in the morning, needless to say we made rather a swift exit.

Reviews.Title: “2 nights in Sophia - if your partner is fussy about clean sheets, don't come”
Reviews.Author: Highadventurer
Reviews.Content: Again i stumbled across this hotel which is round the corner of Paddington station or across the road from Heathrom Express/Connect and intercity rails. They had their price on board ie Stlg 45 for a single and this price do not flucuate towards the weekend as with many hotels which raise their price in tune with demand. The good thing about this hotel is value for money and convinience to the tube and fast food joints, pubs, indian, italian restaurants and good old Angus restaurant chain. The downsides is what you pay is what you get as the bedspread i had have a suspicous big blot, the bathroom tiles can look a tad grotty and the curtains/windows need a good wash. Because this is located on main road and near to St Mary Hospital you may get woken up by sirens of ambulances. As for transport there is a bus that goes to British Museum at Russel Square which traverse through Oxford Street and Bond Street which is good sighting without the need to pay the exobitant open decker buses. You get a complimentary continent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: jedi_master_1978
Reviews.Content: Our hotel was overbooked and they booked a room in Hotel Sophia. The mold was in the bathroom. They don't know what a vacumcleaner is and how they need to clean the room. The widow could not be closed so it was freezing cold in the room. After one day we left the hotel. We don't want to be in this hotel ever again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Sophia
HotelInfo.Address: A, 5 London Street, London W2 1HL, England
